sources.name: Fraser Institute – Economic Freedom of the World
sources.description:
Data provider Fraser Institute
Source Economic Freedom of the World: 2015 Annual Report
Description (Chain-Linked) Economic Freedom of the World Summary Index
Linkhttp://www.freetheworld.com/release.html
Retrieved23 January 2016

Additional information

From the 2015 report: The cornerstones of economic freedom are (1) personal choice, (2) voluntary exchange coordinated by markets, (3) freedom to enter and compete in markets,
and (4) protection of persons and their property from aggression by others.
Economic freedom is present when individuals are permitted to choose for themselves and engage in voluntary transactions as long as they do not harm the person or property of others.
